items.sentence: Tom walked out of the room without looking back.
Tom wanted Mary to tell him about her childhood.
Tom wanted to buy that book and give it to Mary.
Tom wanted to do something really nice for Mary.
Tom would be happy to know you\'ve finally come.
What makes you think that Tom will listen to me?
What number bus do I take to get to Park Street?
When I was a child, I used to swim in that pond.
When Mary was a child, her family was very poor.
You used to be able to see the church from here.
It took me a long time to get used to the noise.
Tom says that he\'s never tried eating dog food.
Tom and Mary were seated across from each other.
Tom asked Mary a few questions about her family.
Tom asked Mary where she wanted to go for lunch.
Tom asked his father to help him make a snowman.
Tom and Mary shouldn\'t have signed confessions.
Tom didn\'t tell me he didn\'t know how to swim.
Tom doesn\'t like cats and Mary doesn\'t either.
I can\'t believe I actually wanted to marry you.
